Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack occurred in London, United Kingdom on June 3, 2017 (1,2). The attack involved a terrorist vehicle-ramming and stabbing, resulting in 8 deaths and 48 injuries (1). Among the victims were two young Australian women (3). This attack was one of several acts of terrorism in the UK in 2017 (4). There have been discussions about the causes of terrorism and Islamophobia following the attack (5). Police are investigating if the attackers were part of a larger network (6). The attack began on London Bridge and then moved to Borough Market (7). The attack is being considered an example of "pure terror" (8). The victims of the attack include Chrissy Archibald (9). The attackers used a rented van as their weapon (10).

Timeline.Text: A terrorist vehicle-ramming and stabbing attack takes place in London, England on London Bridge and Borough High Street.
Police race to establish if the attackers were part of a wider network.
The London Bridge and Borough Market attacks are described as 'pure terror'.
Two young Australian women are confirmed dead in the London Bridge attack.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack resulted in the reopening of Borough Market, which had been closed for 11 days (1,2). Witnesses describe a rampage by three suspects who attacked people in bars and restaurants (3). Police have revealed that the attackers bought knives from Lidl for 4 pounds each (4). Defiant British humor emerged on social media following the attack (5). It has been reported that the third attacker was arrested last year while trying to get into Syria (6). The events of the attack were described in a timeline (7,8). The mayor of London released a statement expressing his condolences and thanking emergency services (9). The attack was also documented on Wikipedia (10).

Timeline.Text: A van drives into pedestrians on London Bridge and crashes in Borough Market, leading to a terrorist attack.
The London Bridge and Borough Market attacks are confirmed as terrorist incidents by the police.
Witnesses describe the horror of the London Bridge attack, with suspects attacking people in bars and restaurants.
The third perpetrator of the London Bridge and Borough Market attack is identified and it is revealed that he had been arrested before for trying to get into Syria.
New details of the London Bridge attack are released by the head of the Metropolitan Police's counter-terrorism unit.
Police reveal that the knives used in the London Bridge attack were bought from a discount supermarket.
Borough Market reopens after being closed for 11 days following the London Bridge attack.
Londoners show their resilience and humour after the London Bridge attack.

Overview.Summary: On June 3, 2017, a van was deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge and then crashed on Borough High Street, where the attackers began stabbing people in and around restaurants and pubs (2,3,5). The attack killed seven people and injured at least 48 others (5). The London Bridge attack is the third terrorist attack in the UK in the past three months (4). One of the suspects, Youssef Zaghba, lived in Barking (3) and the suspects were shot dead by police (5). A Romanian baker who fought off the attackers was hailed as a hero (7). The incident involved a vehicle and a knife (8).

Timeline.Text: A van is deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge, followed by a knife attack in the nearby Borough Market. Seven people are killed and at least 48 are injured.
Maps and graphics show the unfolding of the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks, resulting in seven deaths and 48 injuries.
A Romanian baker is hailed as a hero for fighting off attackers with crates during the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.
Eyewitness videos show the aftermath of the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.
A timeline is released detailing the events leading up to the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.
Borough Market resumes trading 11 days after the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.
New security measures are implemented on London's busiest bridges following the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.

Overview.Summary: On the night of June 3, 2017, a terrorist vehicle-ramming and stabbing took place in London, England (2). The attack occurred on London Bridge, and then continued on Borough High Street (1). Witnesses described a horrific rampage by three suspects who stabbed and attacked people in bars and restaurants (4). The knives used in the attack were purchased for just £4 from the discount supermarket chain Lidl (5). The attackers were later identified as members of a radical group that supported ISIS (9). The attack was the second in London and third in Britain in two months (6).

Timeline.Text: A van is deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge and crashes on Borough High Street, starting a terrorist attack.
Newspapers report on the London Bridge attacks, with witnesses describing the horror of the rampage.
Police reveal that the knives used in the attack were purchased from a discount supermarket for just £4.
The identities of the attackers are revealed, with one being featured in a TV documentary about radical groups.
The final moments of three victims are revealed in an inquest.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack involved a van that was deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge (2, 6). The van then crashed on Borough High Street, and the attackers continued on foot to the nearby Borough Market area (2). The attackers were identified as Rachid Redouane, Khuram Butt, and Youssef Zaghba (3). The attack resulted in the deaths of eight people (8). Security measures were put in place on London's busiest bridges following the attack (4). Witnesses captured footage of the scene in Borough Market after the attack (5). The timeline of the attack shows that the van drove over London Bridge at 9:58pm (7). The victims of the attack included Ignacio Echeverria and Sebastien Belanger (8). The aftermath of the attack was reported on newspaper front pages (9). A vigil was held to remember the victims of the attack (10).

Timeline.Text: A van is deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge and crashes on Borough High Street.
The van's occupants then run to the nearby Borough Market area and begin stabbing people in and around restaurants and pubs.
Security measures are increased on London's busiest bridges in response to the attack.
An eyewitness films the scene from inside Borough Market after the attack.
More details emerge about the attackers, including their identities and connections.
A timeline of the events leading up to and during the attack is released.
The victims of the London Bridge attack are identified.
Newspaper front pages from around the world report on the London Bridge attack.
Vigils are held to remember the victims of the London Bridge attack.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack occurred at 9:58pm on June 3, 2017 (1,3). The attack involved a van and resulted in 7 deaths and at least 48 injuries (1,3,4,8). The Borough Market reopened 11 days after the attack (2). The attack was one of five in 2017 that claimed 36 lives (4,5,7,9). The families of the attackers have condemned their actions (5). The attack was the third in Britain in two months (9). The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack (10).

Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack occurred on June 3 and involved a van being deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge (2,5). The suspects then ran to Borough Market and began stabbing people (1,3). The attack was declared a "terrorist incident" (5,7), and the security services were criticized for not stopping it (4,8). The victims were identified, including Canadian Christine Archibald (6,9). Maps and graphics were used to show how the attack unfolded (10).

Timeline.Text: A white van mows down pedestrians on London Bridge and in Borough Market in a terrorist attack.
The London Bridge attack, including incidents at Borough Market, is officially confirmed as a terrorist incident by the police.
The first victim of the London Bridge and Borough Market attack is named as 30-year-old Canadian Christine Archibald.
The Italian prosecutor reveals that UK officials were alerted about suspect Youssef Zaghba.
The London Bridge and Borough Market attack prompts increased pressure on the British security services.

Overview.Summary: On June 3, 2017, the 2017 London Bridge attack occurred and was carried out by radical Islamist terrorists (1,2). The Islamic State (ISIS) claimed responsibility for the attack (2). The British Prime Minister spoke out against the attack and called for a stronger fight against Islamic terrorism (3,10). The attacker, Khuram Butt, was investigated in 2015 for his connections to banned Islamist group al-Qaeda (9). The attack sparked a rise in Islamophobic hate crimes (7).

Timeline.Text: British PM Theresa May promises to step up fight against Islamic terrorism after London Bridge attack.
The Islamic State claims responsibility for the London Bridge attack.
Khuram Butt, one of the attackers in the London Bridge attack, is identified as a supporter of the banned Islamist group al-Qaeda.
Australian woman Sara Zelenak is confirmed as one of the victims of the London Bridge attack.
Islamophobic hate crimes increase in London following the London Bridge attack.
Thousands of Muslims gather in Cologne to protest against Islamic extremism after the London Bridge attack.
An Islamic State agent attempts to recruit an undercover reporter for an attack on London Bridge.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 London Bridge attack occurred on June 3 and involved a van that drove into pedestrians on London Bridge and crashed into Borough High Street (2,3,10,11). The attack was carried out by three Islamic terrorists (7,9,15,17) and resulted in 8 deaths and 48 injuries (5). The attackers were identified as Khuram Butt, Rachid Redouane, and Youssef Zaghba (9,17). The incident sparked increased security measures on London's bridges (20) and a rise in Islamophobic hate crimes (16).

Timeline.Text: A van deliberately driven into pedestrians on London Bridge, followed by a stabbing attack at Borough Market.
The London Bridge attack is officially confirmed as a terrorist attack. The death toll rises to eight.
The Islamic State claims responsibility for the London Bridge and Borough Market attacks.
The identity of one of the attackers, Khuram Butt, is revealed. He was investigated by police in 2015.
Two Australian women, Sara Zelenak and Kirsty Boden, are confirmed dead in the attack.
Reports of Islamophobic hate crimes in London increase five-fold following the London Bridge attack.
